datafield.subfield: Measurement of the reaction $\gamma p \TO K^ + \Lambda(1520)$ at photon energies up to 2.65 GeV
Measurement of the reaction $\gamma p \TO K^ + \Lambda(1520)$ at photon energies up to 2.65 GeV
BONN-ELSA. Measurement of the total and differential cross sections for the reaction GAMMA P --> K+ LAMBDA(1520) in the energy range from threshold to 2.65 GeV..

The reaction $\gamma p \TO K^+\Lambda(1520)$ was measured in the energy range from threshold to 2.65 GeV with the SAPHIR detector at the electron stretcher facility ELSA in Bonn. The $\Lambda(1520)$ production cross section was analyzed in the decay modes $pK^-$, $n \bar{K}^0$, $\Sigma^{\pm}\pi^{\mp}$, and $\Lambda\pi^+\pi^-$ as a function of the photon energy and the squared four-momentum transfer $t$. While the cross sections for the inclusive reactions rise steadily with energy, the cross section of the process $\gamma p \TO K^+\Lambda(1520)$ peaks at a photon energy of about 2.0 GeV, falls off exponentially with $t$, and shows a slope flattening with increasing photon energy. The angular distributions in the $t$-channel helicity system indicate neither a $K$ nor a $K^\star$ exchange dominance. The interpretation of the $\Lambda(1520)$ as a $\Sigma(1385)\pi$ molecule is not supported.
differential cross section: momentum transfer dependence

00012 (a) Invariant mass distribution $M_{n\pi^-}$ of the $n\pi^-$ system of the $\Sigma^-$-decay for selected events from the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^- \pi^+$, (b) Invariant mass $M_{n\pi^+}$ of the $n\pi^+$ system of the $\Sigma^+$-decay for selected events from the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^+ \pi^-$, (c) Missing mass $M_{\mathrm{miss.},K^+\pi^-}$ recoiling against the $K^+\pi^-$ system for the decay-channel $\Sigma^+ \rightarrow p \pi^0$.

00013 (a) Invariant mass distribution $M_{n\pi^-}$ of the $n\pi^-$ system of the $\Sigma^-$-decay for selected events from the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^- \pi^+$, (b) Invariant mass $M_{n\pi^+}$ of the $n\pi^+$ system of the $\Sigma^+$-decay for selected events from the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^+ \pi^-$, (c) Missing mass $M_{\mathrm{miss.},K^+\pi^-}$ recoiling against the $K^+\pi^-$ system for the decay-channel $\Sigma^+ \rightarrow p \pi^0$.

00014 (a) Invariant mass distribution $M_{n\pi^-}$ of the $n\pi^-$ system of the $\Sigma^-$-decay for selected events from the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^- \pi^+$, (b) Invariant mass $M_{n\pi^+}$ of the $n\pi^+$ system of the $\Sigma^+$-decay for selected events from the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^+ \pi^-$, (c) Missing mass $M_{\mathrm{miss.},K^+\pi^-}$ recoiling against the $K^+\pi^-$ system for the decay-channel $\Sigma^+ \rightarrow p \pi^0$.

00022 Left panel: Acceptance of the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Lambda(1520)$ summed over the decay modes as a function of $E_\gamma$. Right panel: Acceptance for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ K^0_s n$ vs. $E_{\gamma}$ and $\cos{\theta_{K^+}}$.

00021 Left panel: Acceptance of the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Lambda(1520)$ summed over the decay modes as a function of $E_\gamma$. Right panel: Acceptance for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ K^0_s n$ vs. $E_{\gamma}$ and $\cos{\theta_{K^+}}$.

00009 (a) Invariant mass distribution of $\pi^+\pi^-$ pairs after complete selection procedure including a kinematical fit (see text), calculated from the measured 4-momenta and (b) decay time distribution of the $K^0_S$ for selected events from the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ K^0_S n$.\vspace{-2mm}

00018 (a) Missing mass distribution $M_{miss.,K^+}$ recoiling against the $K^+$ for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^- \pi^+$ with the peak of the $\Lambda(1520)$ and a peak due to the $\Sigma(1385)/\Lambda(1405)$ complex, (b) Missing mass distribution $M_{miss.,K^+}$ for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^+ \pi^-$ (for both decay-channels of the $\Sigma^+$) with peaks of the $\Lambda(1520)$ and $\Sigma(1385)/\Lambda(1405)$.

00017 (a) Missing mass distribution $M_{miss.,K^+}$ recoiling against the $K^+$ for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^- \pi^+$ with the peak of the $\Lambda(1520)$ and a peak due to the $\Sigma(1385)/\Lambda(1405)$ complex, (b) Missing mass distribution $M_{miss.,K^+}$ for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^+ \pi^-$ (for both decay-channels of the $\Sigma^+$) with peaks of the $\Lambda(1520)$ and $\Sigma(1385)/\Lambda(1405)$.

00004 Reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow p K^+ K^-$: Invariant mass distribution of the $pK^-$ system with the peak of the $\Lambda(1520)$ (left) and invariant mass distribution of the $pK^-$ system in four energy intervals (right panel).

00005 Reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow p K^+ K^-$: Invariant mass distribution of the $pK^-$ system with the peak of the $\Lambda(1520)$ (left) and invariant mass distribution of the $pK^-$ system in four energy intervals (right panel).

00007 Mass distributions for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+K^0_sn$, (a) Invariant mass of $\pi^+$-$\pi^-$ pairs in preselected 3-track data with $K^0_s$-peak. The following cuts were applied: for the neutron $|M_\mathrm{miss}-0.94$\,GeV$|<0.075$\,GeV and for the $K^+$ a TOF mass information of $m>0.3$\,GeV. (b) Distribution of missing mass recoiling against the three tracks for all selected 3-track events showing a peak due to the missing neutron. \vspace{-2mm}

00020 Decay of $\Lambda(1520)$-hyperons in the channel $\Lambda(1520) \rightarrow \Lambda \pi^+ \pi^-$. Missing-mass distribution $M_{miss.,K^+}$ with the peak of the $\Lambda(1520)$-hyperon a) without further cuts, b) Missing mass plot of the $\Lambda(1520)$-hyperons with an invariant mass $M_{\Lambda \pi^+}$ compatible with the decay channel $\Lambda(1520) \rightarrow \Sigma(1385)^+\pi^-$.\vspace{-4mm}
00011 Missing mass recoiling against the $K^+$ showing the $\Lambda(1520)$ peak.\vspace{-8mm}

00008 Mass distributions for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+K^0_sn$, (a) Invariant mass of $\pi^+$-$\pi^-$ pairs in preselected 3-track data with $K^0_s$-peak. The following cuts were applied: for the neutron $|M_\mathrm{miss}-0.94$\,GeV$|<0.075$\,GeV and for the $K^+$ a TOF mass information of $m>0.3$\,GeV. (b) Distribution of missing mass recoiling against the three tracks for all selected 3-track events showing a peak due to the missing neutron. \vspace{-2mm}

00010 (a) Invariant mass distribution of $\pi^+\pi^-$ pairs after complete selection procedure including a kinematical fit (see text), calculated from the measured 4-momenta and (b) decay time distribution of the $K^0_S$ for selected events from the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ K^0_S n$.\vspace{-2mm}
00015 (a) Decay time distribution of $\Sigma^-$, (b) Decay time distribution of $\Sigma^+$.
00016 (a) Decay time distribution of $\Sigma^-$, (b) Decay time distribution of $\Sigma^+$.
00006 Topology of the reactions $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ K^0_S n$ (a), $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^- \pi^+$ (b) and $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Sigma^+ \pi^-$ (c).

00023 (a) Total cross section for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Lambda(1520)$ as determined in different decay channels, (b) Comparison of the total cross sections for the dominant decay channel $\Lambda(1520)\rightarrow pK^-$ (see (a), squares) gained via integration of the differential cross sections d$\sigma$/d$t$ (upward triangles), and the averaged and integrated differential cross sections (downward triangles) from the four decay channels presented in (a).

00024 (a) Total cross section for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Lambda(1520)$ as determined in different decay channels, (b) Comparison of the total cross sections for the dominant decay channel $\Lambda(1520)\rightarrow pK^-$ (see (a), squares) gained via integration of the differential cross sections d$\sigma$/d$t$ (upward triangles), and the averaged and integrated differential cross sections (downward triangles) from the four decay channels presented in (a).

00025 Differential cross section for the reaction $\gamma p \rightarrow K^+ \Lambda(1520)$ determined via the decay channel $\Lambda(1520)\rightarrow pK^-$ in four photon energy bins as a function of $|t-t_0|$; $t_0$ denotes the minimal kinematically allowed squared four-momentum transfer, which was calculated on an event-by-event basis.

00027 The $\Lambda(1520)$ decay angular distribution in four energy bins in the $t$--channel helicity system. Solid line: complete fit (see text), dashed line: $1+3\cos^2\theta_{K^-}$ corresponding to $K^\star$ exchange, dotted line: $\sin^2\theta_{K^-}$ corresponding to $K$ exchange.

00019 Decay of $\Lambda(1520)$-hyperons in the channel $\Lambda(1520) \rightarrow \Lambda \pi^+ \pi^-$. Missing-mass distribution $M_{miss.,K^+}$ with the peak of the $\Lambda(1520)$-hyperon a) without further cuts, b) with an anticut in the region of the missing mass $M_{miss.,K^+\pi^-}$ of $\Sigma(1385)^+$ decays. Full lines describe the fit, dashed lines the background assumption. \vspace{-4mm}
